options.content:
# Connecting Blocks

The vain of bitcoin. This dashboard represents metrics for connecting blocks.


---

## Flow

  A [NetMsgType::BLOCK](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/prometheus/src/net_processing.cpp#L3592) message is received from the node and thus begins the process of connecting the new block.

  Class CChainState defined in [validation.cpp](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/5335e6aebb466e80850a3a99a3325bccea6e92a8/src/validation.h#L545) handles connecting of new blocks.

  Below are the functions being executed:

  * [ConnectTip](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/5335e6aebb466e80850a3a99a3325bccea6e92a8/src/validation.cpp#L2377)
      * [ReadBlockFromDisk](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/5335e6aebb466e80850a3a99a3325bccea6e92a8/src/validation.cpp#L2395)
      * [ConnectBlock](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/5335e6aebb466e80850a3a99a3325bccea6e92a8/src/validation.cpp#L1711)
          * [Fork Checks](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/5335e6aebb466e80850a3a99a3325bccea6e92a8/src/validation.cpp#L1794)
          * [CheckInputScripts](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/5335e6aebb466e80850a3a99a3325bccea6e92a8/src/validation.cpp#L177)
          * [Update Index](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/5335e6aebb466e80850a3a99a3325bccea6e92a8/src/validation.cpp#L2014)
      * Coin view [Flush](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/5335e6aebb466e80850a3a99a3325bccea6e92a8/src/validation.cpp#L2410)
      * [FlushStateToDisk](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/5335e6aebb466e80850a3a99a3325bccea6e92a8/src/validation.cpp#L2434)
      * [UpdateTip](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/5335e6aebb466e80850a3a99a3325bccea6e92a8/src/validation.cpp#L2449)

---

## GetMainSignals

  During the life-cycle of a new block, a simple interface class, [CValidationInterface](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/5335e6aebb466e80850a3a99a3325bccea6e92a8/src/validationinterface.h#62), is used to notify those interesed in a new block
  
  `UpdatedBlockTip` is called when tip is updated.  This is what the [ZMQ](https://github.com/pro-bitcoin/pro-bitcoin/blob/prometheus/src/zmq/zmqnotificationinterface.h) uses to send messages. Note, these are blocking calls.

--- 

## References

* [Chain](https://developer.bitcoin.org/devguide/block_chain.html)
* [Blocks](https://developer.bitcoin.org/reference/block_chain.html)
* [Signature Ops](https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/67760/how-are-sigops-calculated)
* [Blockchain Header](https://medium.com/fcats-blockchain-incubator/understanding-the-bitcoin-blockchain-header-a2b0db06b515)
* [BIP9 in a Nutshell](https://rusty.ozlabs.org/?p=576)
* [Greg Maxwell: Advances in Block Propagation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EHIuuKCm53o)

---

panels.description:
Current Block Tip State

Fees are in satoshis but represented here by dividing by **COIN** amount, aka satoshis
panels.title: Block Tip

panels.description:
The time since the last block. 

* `Seen` is when this node was notified of block
* `Header-time*` The header block time is a Unix epoch time when the miner started hashing the header (according to the miner). Must be strictly greater than the median time of the previous 11 blocks.
panels.title: Time of  block tip (chain:  ${chain})

panels.description:
A weight unit is the unit used to measure the size of transactions and blocks as of the SegWit upgrade.

 Weight units are abbreviated as ‘wu’. Prior to SegWit, transactions and blocks were measured in bytes, and blocks were limited to 1MB or 1 million bytes. 

After the SegWit upgrade, transactions and blocks are measured by weight units, and blocks are limited to 4 million weight units.
panels.title: Tip Size Witness Weight  (chain:  ${chain})

panels.description:
The maximum allowed number of signature check operations in a block (80,000)

A kind of DoS prevention check. 

E.g. OP_CHECKSIG
panels.title: Tip Signature Operation Cost (chain:  ${chain})

panels.description: Heatmap time difference between block header (from the miner) and node notification (seen) over time.

targets.expr: scalar(block_tip{chain="$chain", type="time", host="$host"}) - scalar(block_tip{chain="$chain", type="header-time", host="$host"})

panels.title: Diff between block header time & seen (host: $host,  chain: $chain)

panels.description:
Average time the ConnectBlock function

Most of the time is spent checking the transactions
panels.title: CChainState::ConnectBlock Average  Time (host: $host,  chain: $chain)

panels.description: Most of the time is spent checking the transactions
panels.title: Number of transaction with tx-check time  (host: $host,  chain: $chain)

panels.description: Number of block transactions. Click on the blue dot to see in a block explorer
panels.title: Block Transactions

panels.description: The value in the block in BTC.  Click on the blue dot to see in a block explorer
panels.title: Block BTC moment/transactions

panels.description: Percentage of  max signature check operations in a block. Max value is **80,000**
panels.title: Signature Operation Costs (host: $host,  chain: $chain)
Legacy Size and Size Witness (host: $host,  chain: $chain)
